text:
Routine is one of the most powerful tools for removing obstacles.  

Without routine, nonessential distractions will overpower us.  

If we create a routine that enshrines the essentials, we will execute them.  

This will happen on autopilot.  

Instead of consciously pursuing the essential, it will occur automatically.  

We won’t expend energy prioritizing everything daily.  

We must expend a small amount of initial energy to create the routine.  

Then, all that is left to do is follow it.  

There is a huge body of scientific research explaining this mechanism.  

Routine enables difficult things to become easy.  

As we repeatedly do a task, neurons make new connections.  

These connections occur through communication gateways called "synapses."  

With repetition, the connections strengthen.  

It becomes easier for the brain to activate them.  

For example, learning a new word takes several repetitions.  

You need various intervals for the word to be mastered.  

To recall the word later, you activate the same synapses.  

Eventually, you know the word without consciously thinking.  

A similar process explains driving from point A to point B.  

You can eventually make the journey without thinking about it.  

After cooking the same meal a few times, you don’t consult the recipe.  

Any mental task gets easier each time we attempt it.  

With repetition, the routine is mastered.  

The activity becomes second nature.  

Our ability to execute the essential improves with practice.  

Think about the first time you performed a critical function at work.  

At first, you felt like a novice.  

You probably felt unsure and awkward.  

The effort to focus drained your willpower.  

Decision fatigue set in.  

You were probably easily distracted.  

This is perfectly normal.  

Once you performed the function repeatedly, you gained confidence.  

You were no longer sidetracked.  

You could perform the function better and faster.  

You did this with less concentration and effort.  

The power of a routine grows from our brain’s ability.  

It takes over until the process becomes fully unconscious.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Creating a routine that prioritizes essentials allows tasks to be executed effortlessly and automatically, reducing the need for conscious effort.
